biography.bio: Stanley Holloway was born on October 1, 1890 in Manor Park, London, England as Stanley Augustus Holloway. He was an actor, known for My Fair Lady (1964), Brief Encounter (1945) and The Lavender Hill Mob (1951). He was married to Violet Lane and Alice Mary Laure Foran. He died on January 30, 1982 in Littlehampton, England.
biography.name: Stanley Holloway

biography.bio: Leslie Dwyer was born on August 28, 1906 in Catford, London, England as Leslie Gilbert Dwyer. He was an actor, known for Hi-de-Hi! (1980), The Way Ahead (1944) and In Which We Serve (1942). He died on December 29, 1986 in Truro, Cornwall, England.
biography.name: Leslie Dwyer

biography.bio: He was born in Garforth, Leeds. His father worked for the NE Railway Company and his grandfather had been manager of Garforth Colliery. His brother Robert's son was the actor David (Henderson) Tate. He went to private schools in York including St Martin's and followed his father into the Railway before joining the Army.
biography.name: Reginald Tate

biography.bio: Meredith Edwards was born on June 10, 1917 in Rhosllannerchrugog, Wales as Gwilym Meredith Edwards. He was an actor, known for A Run for Your Money (1949), The Cruel Sea (1953) and The Lavender Hill Mob (1951). He was married to Daisy Clark. He died on February 8, 1999 in Denbighshire, Wales.
biography.name: Meredith Edwards

biography.bio: British character actor of wry charm, equally at home in amused or strait-laced characters. A native of Bourton-on-the-Water in Gloucestershire, he attended Marlborough College and the Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts. His stage debut came in 1922, and by 1925 he was a busy London actor. He married actress Blanche Glynne (real name: Blanche Hope Aitken) and in 1932 toured South Africa in plays. Alleged to have been spotted by George Cukor during a performance in Aldritch, Hyde-White (with or without Cukor's help) made his film debut in 1934. He often appeared under the name Hyde White in these early films. He continued to act upon the stage, playing opposite Laurence Olivier and Vivien Leigh in "Caesar and Cleopatra" and "Antony and Cleopatra" in 1951. With scores of films to his credit, he will always be remembered for one, My Fair Lady (1964), in which he played Colonel Pickering. Active into his ninth decade, Hyde-White died six days before his 88th birthday. He was survived by his second wife, Ethel, and three children.
biography.name: Wilfrid Hyde-White

biography.bio: Joy Shelton was born on June 3, 1922 in London, England as Joy Winstanley Shelton. She was an actress, known for Designing Women (1948), No Room at the Inn (1948) and The Green Finger (1946). She was married to Sydney Tafler. She died on January 28, 2000 in Surrey, England.
biography.name: Joy Shelton

biography.bio: Raymond Young was born on June 16, 1918 in Chelsea, London, England. He was an actor, known for Adam and Evalyn (1949), El calor de la llama (1976) and Death of an Angel (1952). He died on July 27, 2011 in Littlehampton, West Sussex, England.
biography.name: Raymond Young

biography.bio: Leslie Perrins was born on October 7, 1901 in Moseley, Birmingham, England. He was an actor, known for The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes (1935), The Roof (1933) and Nine Days a Queen (1936). He died on December 13, 1962 in Esher, Surrey, England.
biography.name: Leslie Perrins

biography.bio: Sebastian Cabot was born on July 6, 1918 in London, England as Charles Sebastian Thomas Cabot. He was an actor, known for Family Affair (1966), The Jungle Book (1967) and The Sword in the Stone (1963). He was married to Kathleen Rose Humphreys. He died on August 22, 1977 in North Saanich, British Columbia, Canada.
biography.name: Sebastian Cabot

biography.bio: Campbell Copelin was born in April 1901 in Enfield, Middlesex, England. He was an actor, known for Typhoon Treasure (1938), Brighton Rock (1947) and Clara Gibbings (1934). He died on August 3, 1988 in Melbourne, Australia.
biography.name: Campbell Copelin

biography.bio: Natasha Parry was born on December 2, 1930 in London, England as Natalie Wills. She was an actress, known for Romeo and Juliet (1968), Midnight Lace (1960) and Windom's Way (1957). She was married to Peter Brook. She died on July 22, 2015 in La Baule-Escoublac, Loire-Atlantique, France.
biography.name: Natasha Parry

filmingLocations.location: Nettlefold Studios, Walton-on-Thames, Surrey, England, UK
